author: Mike Bird
title: Turkish Lira Tumbles 5% to Fresh Low
text:
The Turkish lira dropped as much as 5% on Wednesday to a fresh low, adding to the currency’s steep slide this year over the central bank’s lack of action on interest rates that analysts think is desperately needed to combat high inflation.
In morning trade in Europe, the dollar rose to as high as 4.92 lira, before settling back toward 4.85. The currency is now at its weakest level against the dollar since the lira was re-denominated in 2005.
